page.title: 03NATEBY VILLAGE
page.content: THE VILLAGE LIES SURROUNDED BY FELLS, ITS STONE-BUILT HOUSES FRONTING THE JUNCTION OF THE MALLERSTANG AND SWALEDALE ROADS.THERE ARE 24 OCCUPIED HOMES, 2 FARMS AND 3 HOLIDAY COTTAGES. BUILT SOLIDLY ON LIMESTONE AND BROCKRAM, IT REMAINS UNSPOILT WITH A CENTRAL VILLAGE GREEN AND, AT THE EASTERN END, A SPRING, GIVING RISE TO THE BECK WITH TWO CLAPPER BRIDGES. ONE RESIDENT STILL DRAWS HER WATER DAILY FROM THIS SPRING. ALTHOUGH CLOSE TO KIRKBY STEPHEN,THE VILLAGE BOASTS A SHOP, GARAGE, CHAPEL, HAULAGE BUSINESS AND A BUILDER. THE BLACK BULL INN OFFERS MEALS AND ACCOMMODATION AND 3 HOUSEHOLDERS OFFER BED AND BREAKFAST FOR HOLIDAYMAKERS. THE VILLAGE HALL, FORMERLY THE SCHOOL, IS NOW RUN BY COMMITTEE AND IS WELL USED FOR MEETINGS,AS A POLLING STATION FOR ELECTIONS AND ANY VILLAGE ACTIVITY.
